result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jermaine L Basemore in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Jermaine L Basemore.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a DPA hearing.  State requests an adjournment.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Jermaine L Basemore in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Jermaine L Basemore.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defendant is DPA eligible.  State requests a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jermaine L Basemore in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the state. Defense is further requesting an additional Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 02.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine L Basemore in court, appear in person with attorney Theodore OReilly, appear in person.  Defendant Jermaine L Basemore in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Dectective R. Worzalla.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jermaine L Basemore
Current: 8896 N 95TH St, Milwaukee, WI 53224   (Effective: 06-14-2022)
Prior: 8896 N 95TH St, Milwaukee, WI 532224

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jermaine L Basemore in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Jermaine L Basemore in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jermaine L Basemore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c5e6133e-7164-4e97-66e6-4c87ef70fbdb  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
